title: Sunomono (Japanese Cucumber Salad) Recipe
description: Sunomono is a deliciously light Japanese cucumber salad with a refreshing rice vinegar dressing for the perfect balance of sweet and sour flavors.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Vegetable Salad Recipes Cucumber Salad Recipes Sunomono (Japanese Cucumber Salad) 4.7 (339) 255 Reviews 31 Photos Japanese sunomono is delicious and simple to make with thinly sliced cucumbers in a sweet and sour vinegar dressing for a refreshing salad or side dish. Submitted by CHRISTYJ Updated on December 4, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 31 31 31 31 Prep Time: 15 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 5 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings 2 large cucumbers, peeled ⅓ cup rice vinegar 4 teaspoons white sugar 1 ½ teaspoons minced fresh ginger root 1 teaspoon salt Directions Gather all ingredients. Allrecipes/Qi Ai Cut cucumbers in half lengthwise and scoop out any large seeds. Slice crosswise into very thin slices. Allrecipes/Qi Ai Place vinegar, sugar, ginger, and salt in a small bowl; mix well to combine. Add cucumber slices and stir to coat. Allrecipes/Qi Ai Cook’s Note For best flavor results, I refrigerate the salad for at least an hour before serving. I Made It Print 595 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 27 Calories 0g Fat 6g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 5 Calories 27 % Daily Value * Total Fat 0g 0% Sodium 467mg 20% Total Carbohydrate 6g 2% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 3g Protein 1g 1% Vitamin C 3mg 4% Calcium 16mg 1% Iron 0mg 1% Potassium 168mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sunomono (Japanese Cucumber Salad) 01 of 31 Photo by  Allrecipes/Qi Ai 02 of 31 Photo by  LovesCooking 11/28/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow This was such a delicious dish and extremely inexpensive as well. The sweet & sour taste from the sugar and the vinegar is perfectly balanced. The slight heat from the ginger just takes this recipe to the next level. This salad also pairs well with perfectly with most proteins, whether it be poultry, seafood or even a ribeye on the grill. 03 of 31 Photo by  BoogieNYC 12/29/2023 I made this recipe (as I have in the past) with three English cucumbers sliced super-thin on a mandoline and added shallot and omitted the ginger. I added the recommended amount of sugar but it was too sweet so I added some Togarashi to increase the heat and I also added some sesame oil (just slight amount) and we really enjoyed it. So tasty. Make sure to drain the liquid coming off the cucumbers before adding any other ingredients (including salt). We drained the liquid three times -- right after the initial slicing, again after adding the salt, and after an hour before we added all the other ingredients. Bonus: if you have other veg around (say, baby carrots or small mushrooms) pour the spare cucumber pickling liquid into a jar/container and then put the carrots or mushrooms or whatever into the jar and let them pickle over a few days. Season the resultant veggies and enjoy :-) 04 of 31 Photo by  lilitiger 06/26/2021 05 of 31 Photo by  MarkMartinez62 04/27/2021 06 of 31 Photo by  Heidi from the plains 05/26/2020 So tasty. I had to use lemon juice and red wine vinegar to replace the rice vinegar. But it turned out great. 07 of 31 Photo by  France C 07/03/2018 So flavorful, you'd think more ingredients went into this! Very refreshing on a summer day, and would pair perfectly with lettuce wraps. The ginger and rice vinegar add a nice brightness. The only thing I might do differently is to slice the cucumber a bit thicker to prevent them from going soft. I used a mandolin to make slicing easier. Delicious! 08 of 31 Photo by  snow 03/11/2018 09 of 31 Photo by  Hannah McPherson 02/13/2018 This is delicious! I made the recipe as is and I wouldn't change much! Maybe the addition of carrots or red onion but that's it! 10 of 31 Photo by  Lisa Boyd 01/28/2018 Yummy and easy! I added sesame seeds to finish - perfect! 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Mom's Cucumbers 326 Ratings Mexican Cucumber Salad 181 Ratings Tomato Cucumber Salad 159 Ratings Crispy Cucumbers and Tomatoes in Dill Dressing 356 Ratings Cucumber Salad with Rice Vinegar 82 Ratings Cucumber and Avocado Salad 293 Ratings Japanese-Style Sesame Green Beans 471 Ratings Lemony Cucumbers 79 Ratings Cucumber Salad 1,353 Ratings Tabbouleh III 231 Ratings Cucumber Slices with Dill 209 Ratings Mom's Cucumber Salad 608 Ratings Pan Fried Green Beans 103 Ratings Corn, Sweet Onion, and Tomato Salad 66 Ratings Quinoa Tabbouleh 909 Ratings Easy Cucumber Salad 87 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
